job_title: Data Scientist : Rank & Recall Team, Analytical Insights
job_Description: Constructor.io powers product search and discovery for the largest retailers in the world, like Sephora and Backcountry, serving billions of requests every year: you have most likely used our product without knowing it. Each year we are growing in revenue and scale by several multiples, helping customers in every eCommerce vertical around the world. We love working together to help each other succeed, and are committed to maintaining an open, cooperative culture as we grow. We get to the right answer with empathy, ownership and passion for making an impact. The KPI optimization team, within Data Science and Engineering, plays a central role in implementing algorithms that optimize for business KPIs like revenue & conversions. We focus on metrics over features, arming our ranking algorithms with powerful capabilities that bring value to customers in the way they care the most about. The team consists of a mix of ML & Data Engineers owning & collaborating on multiple projects. As a data scientist on the KPI optimization team, you will use world-class analytical, engineering and machine learning techniques on big data to mine insights for our customers and shape the evolution of our search, browse & recommendation products. Challenges you will tackle  Lead the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments that shape decision-making around search, browse & recommendation experiences in a data-driven manner.  Streamline the A/B testing process by introducing new metrics & leveraging techniques like sequential testing.  Take initiative and perform data exploration to understand user behavior, suggest opportunities for improving our recommender & search systems, and implement pipelines for data delivery.   About you  You are excited to leverage massive amounts of data to drive product innovation & deliver business value.  You excel at A/B testing, analyzing observational data, and modeling by utilizing deep knowledge of statistical methods.  You are proficient at SQL (any variant), well-versed in exploratory data analysis with Python (pandas & numpy, data visualization libraries), and have a deep understanding of ML principles. Practical familiarity with the big data stack (Spark, Presto/Athena, Hive) is a big plus.  You are adept at fast prototyping and providing analytical support for initiatives in the e-commerce space by identifying & focusing on relevant features & metrics.  You are skilled at building and maintaining data ingestion pipelines.  You are willing to develop and maintain effective communication tools to report business performance and inform decision-making at a cross-functional level.  Requirements  Skills delivering & communicating business value  Proficiency with Python & SQL for exploratory data analysis & modeling  Strong statistical background & understanding of ML principles  Experience building and maintaining data ingestion pipelines  Experience designing, conducting & interpreting A/B test results  Excellent communication skills with the ability to tailor messages to the target audience  Familiarity with e-commerce or user web analytics & related metrics  Data visualization skills  Practical knowledge of the big data stack  Benefits  Unlimited PTO  A competitive compensation package including stock options  Company-sponsored health coverage  Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact

About Us Our mission is to cure cancer through high performance, accessible early cancer detection. That means saving lives. Delfi Diagnostics is a Johns Hopkins spinoff focused on the non-invasive detection of cancer at earlier stages, when it is most curable. DELFI uses artificial intelligence and whole genome sequencing to detect unique patterns of DNA fragmentation in the blood of patients with cancer. These analyses are performed through simultaneous examination of millions of DNA sequences using machine learning to identify tumor-specific abnormalities. In our passionate pursuit to radically improve health outcomes, we serve humanity when we: Lead with Science, Anchor in Pragmatism: We pioneer life-changing science by ensuring quality, transparency, and rigor at all times. We explore thoughtfully, experiment smartly, and deliver impact with conviction.   Build With & For All: We embrace diverse backgrounds to innovate and achieve together. We are not just building a product - we aim to disrupt the path of cancer for all - no matter geography or socioeconomic class Put We over I: We are a home for high-performing people. Through teamwork, we build collective intelligence. Each of us wins when those we serve and those who serve with us-win. We show up with empathy, humility, and integrity at every step of the journey. As the Director of Clinical Data Management, you will serve as the department leader for all data management components of clinical trials covering management, infrastructure, and processes to meet regulatory requirements.  What you’ll do: Develop processes for eCRF development, eCRF completion guidelines, EDC set-up, UAT, edit checks, data review and query resolution, locking activities, and reporting. Develop processes for data transfers, lock/unlock process, and study database archiving Contribute to infrastructure requirements for interactive data visualization and analytic tools for reporting and data QC Contribute to infrastructure requirements for systems integration between biosample and clinical data Manage and develop internal talent Manage CROs, EDC developers, and other external data management vendors Develop and maintain departmental policies in accordance with regulatory requirements Support regulatory submissions including FDA audit readiness, presentation, and response  What you’ll have accomplished 12 months from now: You will have developed processes and developed departmental policies that meet department requirements, setting the foundation for future clinical trials You will have facilitated and supported the achievement of key product corporate goals  Required: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education/experience in science or health-related 9+ years of clinical data management experience in pharmaceutical, medical device/diagnostic company or CRO. Cross-functional leadership as it relates to clinical study data collection and analysis efforts. Mastery of GCPs, ICH, and regulatory requirements Excellent organizational, written, and verbal communication skills Ability to work independently as well as part of a cross-functional team Demonstrated ability to achieve goals Flexible attitude to adjust to changing needs  Preferred: Industry experience within in vitro diagnostics (IVD) highly preferred; pharmaceutical, biologics or medical device experience can substitute in part for IVD experience Experience with oncology trials and biomarker studies  Delfi Diagnostics requires that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19. Proof of vaccination or sincerely held religious belief and/or medical exemption is required upon hire. Delfi Diagnostics will engage in an interactive dialogue process with employees who have documented medical conditions and/or sincerely held religious beliefs that would prevent them from getting vaccinated, in accordance with all applicable laws An equal opportunity employer We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

iCatalyst, Inc. is an agile solution-oriented business and technology solutions company serving as a trusted partner and advisor to multiple federal and commercial customers since 2007. We are appraised at Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) ML3 in Software Development and our systems are International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 9001:2015 (Quality Management) and ISO 27001:2013 (Information Security) certified. Our expertise and primary support is in areas of Program Management, Software Development, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Enterprise Architecture, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence, and Cyber Security. We have an exciting opportunity for a seasoned  Data Analyst  to join our program team.  We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, short-term disability insurance, life insurance, free Uber rides, and phone reimbursement. Other benefits include 401k, paid government holidays, training, education assistance, wellness benefit, and personal leave.  Job Responsibilities The successful candidate will use their enthusiasm and strong analytical skills to assist the Program Manager on the following: Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Coordinate and acquire data from primary and secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex and large data sets. Develop and maintain metadata definitions, business rules and contextual information for data/information systems. Support studies by analyzing data, organizing findings, and drafting technical papers/studies and other technical white papers. Prepare and present papers and briefs on the results of the analytical studies. Provide support to the program team in providing guidance to organizations engaged in the establishment of international aviation safety data/information standards, taxonomies and methodologies. Provide support to the program team in developing, maintaining and disseminating analytical models and methodologies that can be applied in aviation safety hazard identification. Conduct reviews/evaluations to identify new data/information sources for the system that will enhance aviation safety analysis. Maintain, enhance and develop the application database resource guides, training manuals and system brochures. Conduct user acceptance testing as new safety databases and analytical capabilities are deployed in the application. Required Skills Knowledge of, and ability to work with both waterfall and agile methodologies. Proficiency in Java, SQL, R, REST APIs, and/or Python. Ability to apply analytic methodologies and principles to help define project objectives and strategic direction. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Machine learning, data wrangling, and data visualization skills. Must be able to work independently with the key stakeholders. Strong planning and organizing skills. Ability to prioritize and work effectively towards deadlines. Attention-to-detail and accuracy. Flexibility-Multi-task Adaptability. Ability to interact with a variety of individuals in a courteous and professional manner. Experience/Qualifications Knowledge of and experience working with programming tools like Java, SQL, Python, R etc. Working experience using various tools such as Erwin, Altryx, etc. and cloud such as AWS and MS Azure. Experience in managing or leading Federal IT projects with large teams preferred. Experience supporting multiple projects. Experience with aviation data is preferred. STEM degree from an accredited university. Education Position requires BS/BA in a STEM discipline from an accredited university with 7 years of experience OR a MS/MA degree in a STEM discipline with 5 years of experience. Location Washington, DC or remote Position Type/Hours Full Time Salaried Exempt Contract/Customer Federal Customer Compensation Pay and benefits information for this position will be provided to interested candidates that apply Travel N/A Clearance Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Clearance Other Authorization to work in the US, sponsorship not available For more Information, Please visit: iCatalyst Careers Page iCatalyst Website

job_title: Senior Data Analyst - Employee Performance and Variable Compensation (Remote Eligible)
job_Description: This position is a remote eligible position. You can choose to work at a remote location or at one of Redfin's headquarter locations (Seattle, San Francisco, or Dallas). Redfin is redefining real estate in the consumer’s favor by combining our own technology and agents to create a service that’s better, faster, and costs less. As a Redfinnian, you'll make a difference in critical events in people's lives as they find a home, buy or sell a home, get a mortgage, or rent a home. Our hiring standards are high, yet our culture is humble. We’ve got all the perks, but if what you value most is doing great work in a creative, collaborative, and disciplined environment, join us. As a  Senior Data Analyst - Employee Performance and Variable Compensation  on the People Analytics team, you’ll use some of the most robust real estate data in the world (includes transactions and customer data) to build tools and answer questions that drive key business decisions across the entire company. The ideal candidate for this role loves storytelling with data and can do a deep dive into disparate data sources to find the most accurate answer. They proactively partner with peers and stakeholders to build and automate prediction systems and models and design holistic, scalable dashboard solutions. The Role Become a subject matter expert, define KPIs and present actionable insights to senior leadership on a regular cadence Partner with Finance, Real Estate Operations, Product Management, HR, and Engineering teams You are a Tableau Guru - Work with key stakeholders on the team to develop and deploy a suite of interactive and connected self service Tableau dashboards combining people and operational data to drive business decisions Collaborate with other Analysts to design custom analyses and efficient reporting systems across analytics at Redfin Skills & Experience Bachelor’s degree in the sciences or engineering Expert-level SQL and Excel skills Advanced Tableau skills Experience with variable compensation plans Advanced requirements gathering skills Brilliant communication skills and ability to coordinate between multiple technical teams and team members Experience with R or Python a plus  What We Offer Competitive compensation packages with a salary, bonuses, and restricted stock grants Generous benefits, including three weeks of paid vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, and fully paid family leave Strong startup culture with catered lunches, casual dress code, happy hours, and more To make sure we hire the most qualified people, we’ve designed a multi-step selection process which may include interviews, a homework assignment, and a reference check. We’re excited to get to know you and hope you’re ready to give this opportunity everything you’ve got! Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce. #LI-Remote #LI-CY1 To ensure the health and safety of our workforce, customers and third parties, Redfin conducts background screening after making conditional offers for employment. All screening is conducted consistent with Equal Employment Opportunity Commission guidance and state and local Fair Chance Act guidance, and Redfin encourages applications from, and fully considers, qualified applicants with criminal record histories.

job_title: System Development Engineer II, AWS AI, Deep Learning Frameworks
job_Description: Programming experience with at least one modern language such as C++, C#, Java, Python, Golang, PowerShell, Ruby  2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience  1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.  Job summary Are you excited about pushing the performance boundaries of Machine Learning (ML) and Cloud Computing? AWS AI is looking for an experienced and motivated System Development Engineer who is passionate about improving deep-learning (DL) framework performance on AWS services. Key job responsibilities In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with the latest ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow and MXNet to enable our customers to optimize their deep-learning workloads. You will be responsible for developing and supporting the build system and benchmarks for integration of ML frameworks into the AWS ecosystem. The ideal candidate will bring extensive hands-on experience in creating, maintaining and optimizing production grade build systems and DL benchmarks. You will frequently challenge the status quo and innovate across a wide spectrum of technical areas. You will constantly be working with multiple machine learning partner teams. About the team Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.   Experience creating and maintaining CI/CD pipelines  Experience contributing to an open-source software project  Experience using TensorFlow, PyTorch or Apache MXNet  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Join us as we revolutionize the hospital pharmacy landscape! Our mission is to wow customers with smart, elegant solutions that help healthcare providers increase efficiency, safety and visibility from manufacturer to bedside. Our 'vibe' is start-up, but we already have over 700 customers who are tracking medications using our proven solutions. If you have a knack for making complex things simple and an interest in the practical application of artificial intelligence and IoT technologies, we have a place for you! Kit Check is looking for a  Senior Data Engineer  to help us refine and grow our suite of healthcare data products to further the company's mission of "Medication Intelligence". Our hospital and pharmacy customers rely on us to keep their patients safe and their pharmacies running smoothly while delighting them with every release. By streamlining their pharmacy's daily routines with our RFID inventory management solution and reducing risk and enhancing their compliance with our controlled substance tracking platform, we're committed to improving medication management for our nation's healthcare providers, and our data operations and products are the backbone of our offerings.   The opportunity: The Senior Data Engineer has experience working with both internal, and external, consumers of data products, with a skill for building data architectures and platforms that are robust, extensible, and scalable. Prior experience designing and leading an enterprise-wide data architecture is desirable. This role should use a collaborative and consensus-building approach to the work. This role will cover the spectrum of our data product offerings, from data governance and security to extract, transformation and testing and will work closely with product owners, engineering teams.  You can expect to Define, design, implement and maintain data architectures and infrastructure that unify our core products and 3rd party tools Use best practices and best-of-breed tools to build a modern data infrastructure Develop and champion good data stewardship and governance practices across the company and work closely with Security to ensure customer assurance Design and support customer facing data products both with API and interactive components.  About you You have a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a quantitative or data-intensive field Senior-level experience in a Data Engineering role gained over several companies or coupled with prior experience as a backend engineer Ability to communicate clearly with all audiences about data architecture and implementations Strong written and analytical skills Experience working on modern ETL tools like Stitch and FiveTran, and DBT Experience with modern data warehouse products like Redshift and Snowflake and semi-structured data formats Strong bias for action, documentation and education Ability to work through ambiguity with open communication and autonomy Expert-level mastery of SQL (MySql, Redshift, Athena, Postgres) and db denormalization concepts Exceptional attention to detail Great analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities Strong adaptability and capacity to work in fast-paced environments Proficiency implementing monitoring instrumentation, triaging incidents, resolving customer issues Experience with a data pipeline product like Dagster, Luigi or Airflow Coding experience with Python  Nice to Have Predictive modeling or machine learning experience in Python including use of Pydata/notebooks Experience with AWS services like DMS, Lambda, Athena or Sagemaker Experience working with PHI or other regulated data Knowledge of hospital data systems (e.g. EHR, ADS, purchasing reports, etc.) Knowledge of the pharmaceutical supply chain  What you’ll get from us Opportunity to build a data team culture within the organization, and to shape a data team that has built an industry-leading product A strong voice in what we work on, how it works, and how we build it Trust in your sense of ownership, estimations and design decisions A budget for training and career development Coworkers you'll learn from and who are looking to learn from you Opportunities to solve problems of scale, debt and security to redefine what’s possible in medication intelligence  Our culture Kit Check’s culture is built on collaboration and innovation. There’s room to grow and opportunities to take initiative. You will partner with sharp, motivated teammates looking to disrupt a massive industry—and have fun while doing it. Interested? If helping us define new data-driven medication intelligence products as well as improving products that have a great track record with our customers sounds like the opportunity for you, we'd love to talk! This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States. Why Kit Check? We truly believe that where you work matters and we want happy employees. So join us on our mission – we intend to have a heck of a good time as we get there. Competitive salary Time off when you need it – unlimited vacation days! Generous insurance coverage 401k program with a company match Employee stock options Fun, collaborative culture! Equal Opportunity Employer Veterans/Disabled

At Janus, we believe in a world where healthcare functions efficiently. Join us on our mission to improve the lives of administrative workers and fundamentally change the way work is done. Our team is building a world-class process improvement platform to help healthcare providers generate more cash with less resources. Our employees are our greatest asset, and we are passionate about creating a strong culture with deep purpose. We are entrepreneurial and passionate, yet humble, empathetic, and inclusive. We value the individual and tackle problems as a team. The best idea wins, and teams celebrate together. We're a remote-first, well-funded, and growing fast! Culture Eats Strategy for Breakfast We pride ourselves on being true to ourselves and authentic. We stand on the following tenets:  Ownership - everyone is a contributor and is empowered to drive improvement.  Curiosity - playing and learning every day.  Eagerness - demolishing barriers to building and innovating.  Radical Transparency - openness in communication and decision making across the organization.  Partnership over Profit - prioritizing long-term relationships.  Humility - we strive to be team players, setting aside ego.  Community - nurturing an environment where all employees and partners can thrive.  Our team is fun, innovative, and willing to roll up our sleeves to help each other succeed in a fast-paced environment. At Janus, we're committed to growing and empowering an inclusive community within our company and communities. This is why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives across our organization. We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage everyone to apply for our available positions, even if they don't meet every requirement — including women, people of color, individuals with disabilities and those in the LGBTQIA+ community. Requirements Our Data Science team is committed to creating true, lasting value for our customers. On a day-to-day basis they partner with the product team to convert user stories into technical requirements, and handle data science work from start to finish. The data science team works closely with other engineering teams to ensure a completely delivery of all work, including scripts and pipelines for running models continuously. What Janus is looking for:  Passion for growing your skills, tackling interesting work and complex problems  5+ years of relevant work experience  Strong communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences  Knowledge of statistics/probability, machine learning, deep learning  Comfortable in Python, including libraries such as scikit-learn, tensorflow/pytorch, open-cv/scikit-image, pandas/numpy, spacy/nltk, etc  SQL and database experience  Experience with cloud environments, AWS specifically is a plus  BA/BS in Computer Science, related field, or equivalent experience In addition, these skills would be helpful:  Familiarity with unit and integration tests  Experience building deployment systems such as CI/CD and Test Automation  Experience with computer vision  Experience with Operations Research or mathematical optimization  Benefits  Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)  Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)  Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)  Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)  Work From Home  Stock Option Plan  Flexible Schedule

Company Overview WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.  CNN invented cable news in 1980, defined online news in 1995 and is now taking the next step in expanding what news can be by launching CNN+. With an unrivaled global reach, storytelling, and world class talent, we are building CNN+, a streaming product that will grow the reach and scope of the CNN brand in a way that no one else is doing.  We are journalists, designers and technologists, all united by a powerful mission to inform, engage and empower the world. Join the most trusted and recognized name in news as we build our next chapter. Join us. Shape your story here. We are looking for Mobile Engineers to help us significantly scale how we experiment, build, and collaborate on ML-based data products. We are currently optimizing our first ML platform to help accelerate our experimentation and model production, and we would love for you to join us in making a huge impact on the overall organization. This is a remote position, and candidates who live near a CNN office are welcome but not required to work from an office as desired. Here’s some of the problems you’ll be helping us solve: The news cycle moves fast. What can we learn from readers’ engagement with breaking news to recommend writing or video which deepens their understanding? How can we create a virtuous recommender system which drives diversity in people’s reading habits? What’s the best way for a machine learning group to work closely with journalists and editors to keep our audience engaged and informed? What are the right UI/UX patterns to follow to provide personalized content while also making sure our news feeds contains the most important top stories? What You’ll Do Develop new personalized UI/UX experiences in CNN’s iOS and Android apps Architect and build intuitive, simple and elegantly designed mobile features and apps that people want to use Author, test, review, and optimize production-level code while executing best practices in version control and code integration Work with mobile engineers on our team to make sure our experiences and experiments are aligned Collaborate with engineers in our Core News and other client-facing teams to roll out and maintain machine learning powered surfaces throughout the app Collaborate with machine learning and software engineers, ops, product teams and other key stakeholders and drive ML-powered features from conception to completion Who You Are You're well-rounded with experience on web and mobile technologies, with demonstrated ability to develop new innovative applications as well as maintain and iterate on existing apps and code You understand the constraints of working with a growing team and thrive in an environment that is fast-paced and sometimes scrappy. You understand that working with user data in recommendations or other systems comes with a host of privacy and security concerns, and you are both creative and principled in how you approach it. You can work independently when needed, and contribute to multiple team projects simultaneously. You have a deep curiosity and are proactive in seeking innovative solutions to business problems. You believe in iterating quickly, and removing any and all obstacles that slow down turning ideas into deployable code. You are an efficient communicator with your team and collaborators. You know when and why to offer feedback, to get help, or to advocate for your ideas. Things You Should Know Demonstrated full-stack (mobile native, mobile hybrid, mobile web, and API) experience leveraging container and cloud technologies such as React Native, Swift, Kotlin, NodeJS, Docker, Kubernetes, and serverless frameworks How to work in a shared client codebase with multiple teams working on multiple features, while prioritizing and representing your own team’s work in cross-functional planning Mobile DevOps and CI/CD tools and best practices Best practices in software engineering such as testing, working with a source control system like Git, reviewing code General familiarity with SQL and database technologies How to work in cloud computing platforms (AWS) Things You Might Know Experience with Terraform, AWS CloudFormation or a similar IaC (infrastructure-as-code) tool NoSQL, columnar, and/or graph database proficiency How to work in collaboration with machine learning engineers, data scientists, product owners, and analysts to instrument an app in a way that collects the right data for learning Experience building flexible software architecture to accommodate multiple stakeholders and business needs If you don’t know any of these, that’s OK- you’ll get the opportunity to learn them on the job once you join! The Perks Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies Access to in-house learning and development resources Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

job_title: Senior Technical Product Manager (Workforce Intelligence Science Models)
job_Description: Bachelor degree in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering/Science, Human Centered Design or related fields)  5+ years of experience gathering complex and cross functional business requirements, translating them into user stories, and working with tech teams to build upon those requirements and launch products.  3+ years owning or influencing technical architecture for software, web development and/or big data solutions.  The vision of Workforce Intelligence is to design the ideal workforce to meet the customer promise anywhere. The Workforce Intelligence team applies data and insights to optimize the experience and operations for Amazon’s largest candidate population – Tier 1 Employees, who bring the magic of Amazon’s industry-leading Customer Fulfillment experience to life. The pace at which job creation and hiring must happen to support the scale and complexity of Amazon businesses is a problem Amazon is uniquely qualified to solve for and continually innovate on. Workforce Staffing (WFS) literally hires by the hundreds of thousands across multiple role times, job attributes, and for a range of business lines. As part of WFS’ Workforce Intelligence organization, the Science Models Sr. Technical Product Manager will be the global owner designing and building out a holistic Insight Store for our business line staffing funnel that would be leveraged by all of Amazon. The Store would be a centralized science-driven product which helps all Amazon business lines make decisions by serving as a knowledge center and providing at-scale, highly-accurate predictions/forecasts for Tier One employee staffing needs. The product would be powered by science and machine-learning models based on high volumes of candidate/employee data, a high dimensional matrix of labor orders, application funnel attributes/data points, outputs of various simulations, trigger and market indicators, and deliver reliable recommendations/actions to site leaders, labor planning teams and other users. WFS supports multiple businesses throughout Amazon's fulfillment ecosystem and this role will work directly with cross-functional leaders to define mechanisms and tools that arm them with actionable insights & recommendations to drive data-driven decision-making based on research and historical trends. You will work with a diverse team of Research and Data Scientists, SDEs, Data Engineers and BIEs to design personalized, best in class analytical products for our internal workforce. This role requires a uniquely gifted athlete who is naturally curious and runs towards big challenges. You will build out a product management framework including stakeholder analysis and research, prioritization and product reviews, intake/backlog grooming, and build/design personalized analytical experiences. This will be a highly visible and global role impacting all of Amazon Fulfillment. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to see and feel a tangible impact to your work, this is the role for you.  Key responsibilities include:   Represent your customers constantly and drive predictive and action-oriented tools.  Live for a team culture that produces what the customer needs, not just what they ask for.  Design and Build a personalized experience for your users.  Lead Product Definition – Own and drive the customer working backwards strategy, tenets, long-term goals and working backwards documents (press release, FAQ) including customer and market feedback, competitive analysis and business metrics to inform direction.  Define Product Vision – Including all aspects to future roadmap, investment, innovation and experimentation.  Execution of Product Planning and Development – Including customer goals and business requirements for product release, ensuring implementation is aligned with product goals and requirements, and ownership of product positioning.  Lead Product Launch – Own the go-to-market plan to deliver results that ensure the customer and business goals are met in operational launch plans.  Lead Operations – Including monitoring and response to customer feedback, continuous improvement and business growth  Lead interaction with Technical Team – Including helping the technical team make trade-offs based on customer requirements, QA/testing of the product.  MBA or related Master’s degree preferred.  2+ years of experience building deep-learning-driven products.  Working knowledge of deep learning, statistical modeling, machine learning and statistics.  Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results in a fast-paced environment.  Excellent analytical skills to dive deep into data, drive insights development and actions.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with demonstrated experience engaging and influencing senior executives.  Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts and manage feature delivery and product tradeoffs.  High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.  Strong interpersonal skills.  Innate curiosity for web based tools, cloud computing and big data.  Strong organizational and negotiation skills.  Experience in workforce/people analytics in a multinational organization/context.  Experience working on agile development teams.  Ability to travel up to 10%.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.  Inclusive Team Culture Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have 12 affinity groups (employee resource groups) with more than 87,000 employees across hundreds of chapters around the world. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which reminds team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Flexibility It isn’t about which hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We offer flexibility and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career Growth We care about your career growth too. Whether your goals are to explore new technologies, take on bigger opportunities, or get to the next level, we'll help you get there. Our business is growing fast and our people will grow with it.

job_title: Lead Statistical Programmer Analyst II, Clinical Reporting
job_Description: Job Description  We are currently seeking a Lead Statistical Programmer Analyst II (Lead SPA II), Clinical Reporting to join our growing team. In this role you will act as a lead statistical programmer analyst, supporting the clinical reporting production programming and verification for client regulatory submissions and publications. Critical client project activities are reporting database development (SDTM and ADaM), statistical and clinical reporting, verification and submissions support.  Specific responsibilities include:  Lead SAS programming and analysis support of the generation of analysis datasets, statistical analysis, listings, figures, and tables  Perform SAS programming and analysis support of the generation of analysis datasets, statistical analysis, listings, figures, and tables  Develop SAS application code  Perform validation of SAS programs and deliverables  Assists in designing data presentations  Perform SDTM and ADaM mapping  Generate SDTM and ADaM deliverables  Generate all necessary output for the compilation of statistical appendices for CTR, ISS, and ISE  Generate data files and/or output for safety updates, publications and meeting presentations  Interface with a cross-function of client and Navitas Data Sciences team members  Serve as an Expert in two or more areas that may include Project Management, SCE, SDTM, ADaM, define.xml, SAS programming, deliverables process, Tables, Graphics, PK/PD, Registries, or other areas  Lead one project team at a client  Desirable Skills and Experience  15+ years pharmaceutical or CRO industry experience in CDISC, clinical reporting, and statistical programming  Strong competence in SAS/Base, SAS/Macro, and SAS/STAT programming  2 years of supervisory experience  Working knowledge of CDISC, SDTM and ADaM  Expert knowledge of SAS-based statistical programming  Proficiency in SAS programming on multiple platforms and operating systems, e.g. Windows, UNIX, etc. is desirable  Proficiency in R programming is desirable  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills  Motivation and skills for growth into project management is desirable  Background in statistics and statistical analysis is desirable   US - Remote  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics or equivalent, Master’s degree preferred  Manager  Data Sciences  Full Time  15 Oct 2021

job_title: Administrative Assistant III, Statistics and Data Science
job_Description: Cornell University embraces diversity and seeks candidates who will contribute to a climate that supports students, faculty and staff of all identities and backgrounds. We strongly encourage individuals from underrepresented and/or marginalized identities to apply.  Effective immediately, all new Cornell hires, regardless of work location,  must be fully vaccinated with an FDA- or WHO- authorized or approved COVID-19 vaccine or have obtained a university-approved disability/medical or religious exemption  by January 18, 2022, or before their start date if after January 18.  Who We Are: Cornell Computing and Information Science (CIS) is a college-level unit with the mission of integrating computing and information science—its ideas, technology, and modes of thought—into every academic field. Working with seven colleges and four professional schools, CIS brings its Computer Science, Information Science and Statistics and Data Science faculty together with faculty throughout the university. The Department of Statistics and Data Science (SDS) is an integral part of the Faculty of Computing and Information Science. It offers Biometry and Statistics and Statistical Science majors in the Colleges of Arts & Sciences and Agriculture and Life Sciences, and it has graduate programs for the degrees of Master of Applied Statistics and Ph.D. The Statistics and Data Science Department is a multi-college partnership, which is a collaboration of the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS), Computing and Information Science (CIS) and the school of Industrial and Labor Relations (ILR). The department combines the traditional tools of statistics, a solid foundation in probability theory, and the skills of computer science into a single, radically collaborative department. What you will do: The administrative assistant provides a range of general administrative support to Lecturers and Faculty in the Statistics and Data Science department. There is a student services component to this position, which involves collaborating with faculty, lecturers, students, CoECIS Payroll, and the Director of Administration in expediting the processing and approval of undergraduate student appointments in SDS. This position is full time, benefits eligible and is located in Ithaca, New York. This position is expected to work on the Ithaca campus as well as perform a portion of the work remotely as agreed upon with the hiring manager. What We Need: Formal training beyond HS of 6 months to 1 year, with 2-3 years administrative experience or equivalent combination. Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills required. Must be detail-oriented and demonstrate sound judgment. Exceptional customer service skills and ability to handle competing priorities required. Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a member of a team. Ability to work effectively with a diverse group of individuals including faculty, staff, students and visitors. Must project a professional image and demonstrate the ability to diplomatically handle a wide variety of situations. Proficiency in word processing (Microsoft Office), calendar program, spreadsheets (Excel) and email. What We Prefer  : Associate’s degree. Advanced knowledge of Cornell systems. These include Faculty Center, Workday, eShop, Gradescope and Canvas. Rewards and Benefits: We hope you appreciate great benefits. Cornell receives national recognition, as an award-winning workplace for our health, wellbeing, sustainability, and diversity initiatives. Our benefits program includes comprehensive health care options, access to wellness programs, employee discounts with local and national retail brands, and generous retirement contributions. Our leave provisions include three weeks of vacation and 12 holidays: e.g., an end-of-year winter break, from December 25th through January 1st. Cornell's impressive educational benefits include tuition-free Extramural Study and Employee Degree Program, Tuition Aid for external education, and Cornell Children's Tuition Assistance program. We invite you to follow this link to get more information: https://hr.cornell.edu/sites/default/files/documents/benefits_overview_endowed.pdf How to Apply: When applying through our system,  please submit both a cover letter and resume/CV for full consideration  . You can upload documents either by “dragging and dropping” them into the dropbox or by using the “upload” icon on the application page. For more detailed instructions on how to apply to a job at Cornell, visit How We Hire on the HR website. If you are an internal employee, please log in to Workday . Visa sponsorship and relocation assistance are not available with this position.  University Job Title: Administrative Asst III Job Family: Administration Level: C Pay Rate Type: Hourly Company: Contract College Contact Name: Renee Lobdell Number of Openings: 1 Job Titles and Pay Ranges: To learn more about Cornell’s non-union staff job titles and pay ranges, see Career Navigator . The final rate of pay for the successful candidate will be determined considering the following criteria: Prior relevant work or industry experience. Education level to the extent education is relevant to the position. Unique applicable skills. Current Employees: If you currently work at Cornell University, please exit this website and log in to Workday using your Net ID and password. Select the Career icon on your  Home  dashboard to view jobs at Cornell. Online Submission Guidelines  : Most positions at Cornell will require you to apply online and submit both a resume/CV and cover letter. You can upload documents either by “dragging and dropping” them into the dropbox or by using the “upload” icon on the application page. For more detailed instructions on how to apply to a job at Cornell, visit How We Hire on the HR website. Employment Assistance: If you require an accommodation for a disability in order to complete an employment application or to participate in the recruiting process, you are encouraged to contact Cornell University's Department of Inclusion and Workforce Diversity at voice  (607) 255-3976 , fax (607) 255-7481, or email at owdi@cornell.edu . For general questions about the position or the application process, please contact the Recruiter listed in the job posting. Applicants that do not have internet access are encouraged to visit your local library, or local Department of Labor. You may also visit the office of Workforce Recruitment and Retention Monday - Friday between the hours of 8:30 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. to use a dedicated workstation to complete an online application. Notice to Applicants: Please read the required Notice to Applicants statement by  clicking here  . This notice contains important information about applying for a position at Cornell as well as some of your rights and responsibilities as an applicant. EEO Statement: Diversity and Inclusion are a part of Cornell University’s heritage. We are a recognized employer and educator valuing AA/EEO, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. We also recognize a lawful preference in employment practices for Native Americans living on or near Indian reservations. Cornell University is an innovative Ivy League university and a great place to work. Our inclusive community of scholars, students, and staff impart an uncommon sense of larger purpose, and contribute creative ideas to further the university's mission of teaching, discovery, and engagement. 2021-12-09-08:00

About SugarCRM, Inc. SugarCRM is a customer experience (CX) leader enabling businesses to create profitable customer relationships by delivering highly relevant, personalized experiences throughout the customer journey. We empower companies to strengthen existing customer relationships, create new ones through actionable insights and intelligent automation and better understand the customer at every stage of the journey. This enables businesses to accelerate demand generation, grow revenue, deliver superior customer care and increase loyalty. Our easy-to-use, intuitive platform makes customer experience easy and accessible for everyone, allowing marketing, sales and services professionals to focus on high-impact, value-adding activities that create customers for life. SugarCRM will continue to offer a flexible workplace supporting employees interested in either working in one of our physical offices, working from home, or working from a combination of the two. Please work with your recruiter to understand any location constraints of a particular role and to communicate your location preferences.  Impact you will make in the role: Work on data preprocessing and feature engineering of time series, structured and unstructured CRM data (using NLP and other techniques) Participate in developing, improving, and refining and machine learning and deep learning models and data processing systems Research and implementation of state-of-the-art statistical solutions from research papers Collaborate with engineering, QA, and product development teams Tech Stack: Python, AWS Technologies, Ray Framework, SQL, NoSQL, Time-Series and Graph DBs  Expertise you will bring in: Degree in data science, computer science or a related discipline Understanding of Machine learning and Deep Learning fundamentals Expertise in writing productional level python code (3+ years hands-on experience) Experience working with databases Experience in data analysis and predictive modeling (data extraction and preparation, feature engineering, machine/deep learning model building and deployment), ideally full cycle Working experience with popular ML/DL frameworks like Scikit-learn, Keras, or PyTorch Experience in working with and integrating external data sources is a plus Experience with time-series, graph based deep learning and graph databases is a plus Experience in working closely with cross-functional teams  We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we’re looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.  Benefits and Perks: Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some sweet benefits and perks:   Excellent healthcare package for you and your family  Savings and Investment – 401(k) match  Unlimited Paid Time Off  Paid Parental Leave  Health and Wellness Reimbursement Program  Travel Discounts  Educational Resources - Career & Personal Development Program  We are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career!

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations. With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life. Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well. Senior Statistical Programmer Overview: Provides statistical programming support for the implementation of data models and the reporting of clinical trials.  Responsibilities Responsibilities: Manage extremely large datasets for statistical analysis and mathematical model creation. Demonstrate expert knowledge and understanding of analysis data structure standards (ADaM) and a good understanding of conversion data structure standards (SDTM). Apply leadership skills in the coordination of analysis and reporting activities for multiple statistical programming projects.  Qualifications Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or scientific field required. Master’s preferred. 5+plus years of statistical programming experience. Expert knowledge and understanding of analysis data structure standards (ADaM) and a good understanding of conversion data structure standards (SDTM). Expertise in computer programming, statistical analysis systems (SAS), and other procedural languages. Fully understands biometrics procedures, workflows, and software systems. Excellent written and oral communication skills required. Benefits of Working in ICON:  Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That’s why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture – one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development.  At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future.  ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.  If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know. job_title: Sales Director, Life Science for Data Services and...
job_Description: Sales Director, Life Science for Data Services and Software Sales BC Platforms is looking for an experienced Sales Director for life sciences to join our North America sales team, preferably located in the Eastern part of the US. Reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer in North America, this individual will leverage key account-based relationships and experience to drive data services and software platform sales in the life science market, including large, mid-market, and emerging pharma accounts. This individual will work alongside senior management and both internal and external partners to develop and to execute our commercial strategy for the region. Primary responsibilities include opening new accounts, securing new business and managing / growing key accounts. Revenue generation and continued strong growth will be the focus of this position. BC Platforms is able to provide access to high-quality, standard-of-care globally sourced Real World Data (RWD) that allows the customer to better understand the specific patient cohort. BC Platforms is able to provide access to clinical, genomics and imaging data. We have access to a significant amount of GDPR or HIPAA compliant data from Europe, North America, Africa and Asia which is a key differentiator for the company. As a SaaS company, BC Platforms also provides very advanced technology platforms and data management capabilities that enable the customer to maximize the value of the data. What you will be working on:  Managing and driving the development of key life science and pharma accounts in the assigned region  Building long term commercial plans for agreed key accounts  Becoming a trusted advisor to targeted stakeholders through consultative selling techniques  Selling to C-Suite, Physicians, Researchers, IT, Procurement, and Clinical laboratories  Securing both small (100K) and large (>3M) deals  Negotiating pricing and contractual agreements  Prospecting and developing key senior-level relationships within the segment  Generating leads in a new market  Researching complex organizations and positioning our solutions to address specific customer needs and pain points  Developing use cases for new prospective customers and driving tactical plan towards the deal close  Performing effective sales presentations  Ensuring that our clients receive the highest level of sales and operational customer service  Working with our solution team to craft and deliver high-quality responses to RFPs  Maintaining relationships with our external partners  Continuously learning and developing relevant industry skills  The ideal candidate should possess:  Professional experience and track record:  5-7 years of experience in sales and/or business development into pharma companies with a track record of success of selling data services and / or software solutions  Understanding of the drug development lifecycle and clinical healthcare market, including early-stage research and late stage development (Clinical, Epidemiology, Medical Affairs) and their related stakeholder ecosystems  Experience in RWD company, Life Science company, CRO, and/or consulting firm  An existing network of contacts at Life Science companies to reach out to  Understanding of applications of genomics to drug development or life sciences segment  Experience and success in positioning complex technology or data solutions to drug developers  Proven history of excellent account management, enterprise selling, negotiation and deal-closing competences  Expert knowledge of sales planning, prospecting and business development  Other knowledge and capabilities:  Excellent leadership qualities required with advanced strategic thinking  Self motivated with strong organizational skills and high desire to succeed  Disciplined, motivated and able to drive her/himself in daily sales tasks  Ability to work in a fast-moving often-changing environment  Experience with Google Suite (Gmail, Google Drive, Google slides) and Microsoft Suite (PowerPoint, word, excel)  Experience with SalesForce.com or similar CRM tool  Education and language:  At least a Bachelor's Degree in Biotechnology, Medical Technology, Pharmacy or in a related field, Master´s Degree preferred  Fluent in English   Additional Information BC Platforms offices are based in Helsinki, Zurich, Boston, and Singapore requiring flexibility in scheduling meetings across geographies. This position could be preferably located in the Eastern part of the US. This position is home office based with expected travel, including international travel, up to 50% of the time. Application Please apply as soon as possible but no later than December 3, 2021. Send us your application via LinkedIn Easy Apply or via our Career Site https://careers.bcplatforms.com/jobs. With any questions related to the job description, please send them to weston.fox@bcplatforms.com. Who we are BC Platforms is a global leader in providing a powerful data and technology platform for personalized medicine and drug development, accelerating the translation of insights into clinical practice. BC Platforms operates the Global Data Partner Network BCRQUEST.com, which provides access and analytics on genomic and clinical cohort data for drug developers currently providing access to over 22m subjects across five continents. Our technology drives the infinite loop between personalized care and research discoveries, leveraging latest science, deep technical expertise, strategic partnerships, and harmonized, diverse data collections. Our high performing platforms enable high throughput genomic data production, flexible data integration, secure data management, efficient analysis and interpretation of molecular and clinical information. Founded in 1997 from an MIT Whitehead project spinoff, the Company has a strong scientific heritage underpinned by over 20 years of working in close collaboration with a network of leading researchers, developers, manufacturers and vendors. BC Platforms has global operations with its headquarters in Zurich, Switzerland, research and development in Espoo, Finland, and sales and marketing in Boston, USA, London, UK and Singapore. For more information, please visit www.bcplatforms.com.

job_title: Patent Agent / Patent Engineer / Software AI CS Computer
job_Description: *** APPLY TO:  mark [at] iprecruiter.org *** Patent Agent / Patent Engineer / Software AI CS Computer / USA 00000 3226 In-house Patent Agent or Patent Engineer. This is a 100%, full-time remote opportunity within a software startup that has developed a novel technology platform consisting of very exciting technology advancements relating to cryptography, cybersecurity, blockchain, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and biometrics. These advancements are being employed in an extremely wide variety of consumer and commercial applications. This highly progressive company is in need of an experienced Patent Engineer and/or Patent Agent who can efficiently communicate with inventors to efficiently draft comprehensive, high quality invention disclosures and initial patent applications, as well as prosecute such applications for a rapidly expanding docket.  Requirements:   B.S. or higher, ideally in computer science, computer engineering, or electrical engineering  An in depth understanding of modern cryptography, cybersecurity, blockchain, artificial intelligence (AI) technologies  At least 3 years of patent experience, either (i) as a licensed Patent Agent, or (ii) as a Patent Engineer who has been drafting invention disclosures while with working closely with Patent Agents/Attorneys to write and prosecute patents  Patent experience specifically relating to software, Alice/101 rejections, etc.   Note regarding preferred background: A USPTO license is not required, but an understanding of how to author patent claims and respond to USPTO office actions is essential. Your responsibilities and role will be determined by your capabilities and experience. This company is in the position to hire multiple patent professionals as they bring more of the work in-house, thus there is opportunity for various levels of experience, ranging from a moderately experienced Patent Agent to a highly experienced Patent Agent. This is a full-time opportunity within a very entrepreneurial entity, thus there is high flexibility regarding how the person may be compensated and hired (e.g., salaried employee with benefits, 1099 contractor, etc.).  Relevant Terms:  patent law, patent prosecution, claims drafting, USPTO, patent engineer, patent agent, patent claims, patent prosecution, USPTO, office actions, Alice, Section 101 rejections, software patents, cryptography, cybersecurity, blockchain, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), biometrics, cloud computing, digital currency, cryptocurrency, cypher, cyber, asset security, computer intrusion detection, Web Hypertext Application Technology Working Group (WHATWG), European Computer Manufacturers Association (ECMA), National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), electrical engineering, computer science, in-house jobs, salaries, salary, pay, compensation, agency, agencies, job, legal search firm, law firm recruiting, recruiter, recruitment, top recruiters, best headhunters, headhunter, list, hiring trends, positions, openings, postings online, patents, patent law, remote, work from home, telecommute, virtual office  *** APPLY TO:  mark [at] iprecruiter.org ***  Notes for Potential Candidates: All fees are paid by client firms and companies. As a consequence of our reputation for having integrity and providing results, we often work on exclusive assignments that are not advertised. We have been successfully building relationships with leaders in the IP community since 1986. Another important distinction is that we work directly with the decision makers (partners, managing counsels, etc.) that make the determinations regarding who will be interviewed, who will be extended an offer, etc. You have our express commitment that all information is accepted in confidence and that no resumes are submitted without first speaking to you and obtaining your explicit permission.  Additional Notes: We are actively recruiting for numerous other opportunities  IP Attorneys, Patent Agents, and Technical Advisors (e.g., electrical, software, chemical, biological, and mechanical)  All levels of experience, inclusive of managing counsels and practice mergers  Corporations and law firms of all sizes  Various locations, literally from coast to coast, including telecommute scenarios  If this particular opportunity does not match your background and/or interests, please do not hesitate to email me directly: mark [at] iprecuiter.org  *** APPLY TO:  mark [at] iprecruiter.org *** Patent Agent / Patent Engineer / Software AI CS Computer / USA 00000 3226

job_title: Data Science and ML Competitive Intelligence Architect
job_Description: As a Data Science and ML Competitive Intelligence Architect, you will dive deep into the capabilities and go-to-market strategies of leading Data Science and ML solutions and provide analysis on their strengths and weaknesses vs Databricks. You will partner with field engineering, sales & customer success, technical enablement, and product marketing to accelerate the adoption of Databricks for Data Science and ML workloads. You will partner with product management to incorporate field competitive intelligence into the product roadmap.  You will report to the Field Engineering Competitive Leader.  The impact you will have:   Leverage conferences, public information, and customer engagements to identify current & emerging competitive threats at a technical level  Synthesize technical information to build a "so what" value proposition and identify novel methods for approaching competitive situations  Work with GTM teams to create technical competitive sales strategies, product demonstrations, collateral, and tools to improve sales effectiveness.  Provide direct support to sales, field engineering, and customer success team to help close competitive opportunities  Develop training and competitive collateral for audiences of varying technical backgrounds  Support product marketing with messaging, competitive threats, and product launch strategies derived from your competitive analysis   What we look for:   The ability to clearly express technical concepts, including presenting and whiteboarding, with customers, team leaders, and senior executives across our organization  3+ years experience selling, architecting, or implementing cloud-native Data Science and ML solutions  1+ years experience in a formal or informal competitive role  B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience in software or a technologically relevant field  Open to travel up to 25% per month  While candidates in the listed locations are encouraged for this role, we are open to remote candidates in other locations.   Benefits:   Medical, dental, vision  401k Retirement Plan  Unlimited Paid Time Off  Fitness reimbursement  Employee referral bonus program  Awesome coworkers  Headphone allowance  Home office allowance  Maternity and paternity plans   COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  As a federal government contractor, Databricks requires new U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of vaccination will be required as a condition of employment. Databricks will make reasonable accommodations based on medical conditions or religious grounds for qualified candidates in accordance with applicable law. About Databricks  Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 5,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, H&M, and over 40% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Lakehouse Platform to unify their data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world’s toughest problems.

Transparent.ly was founded in 2018 and has been profitable since its second quarter. Acquired by National General in just over 18 months from inception, Transparent.ly continues to enjoy explosive revenue growth in insurance verticals in 2020 and 2021. We now have over 30 team members and we are interested in hiring passionate and exceptionally talented people to join our team. Primary Purpose: Focus on optimizing the performance of advertisements for advertisers and publishers working with Transparent.ly. Review a wide variety of voluntary consumer data that is ingested by Transparent.ly and optimize the resulting ads shown to consumers to improve click through rates as well as end of funnel performance for advertisers. Optimize the consumers that are sent to advertiser landing pages to improve the rate at which the consumers purchase a policy or loan. Transparent.ly is a real-time clicks bidding platform that allows advertisers to precisely bid for consumers with our ad technology platform. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time. Serve as a hands on data scientist who can make insights using advanced techniques and apply those insights to improve performance Analyze a large body of consumer data to improve click-through-rates on ads Analyze advertiser performance data to identify consumer attributes most closely associated with purchase for a particular advertiser Optimize consumer demand while balancing advertiser performance Create and make bidding strategies in the platform to execute on findings Champion and project manage data related initiatives with engineering and business teams to improve the data science capabilities of Transparently Explain methodologies and insights to company executives and clients to gain buy in Manage a team and develop the data science practice within the company Establish and organize a regular process to conduct client optimizations and communicate actions to fellow team members and clients Minimum Skills and Competencies: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Bachelor Degree or in-lieu of degree equivalent education, training and work-related experience 3+ years of applied data science experience Strong background in statistics and applied techniques (linear/non-linear, probability, bootstrapping, etc) Experienced in predictive analytics, in particular ad performance prediction Deep learning / neural networks experience, including applying clustering, classification and random forest Experience creating algorithms (regressions, simulations, decision trees, neural networks, Bayesian, clustering, etc) and models that best solve for given business opportunities and challenges Clear thinker who can communicate complex concepts in terms everyday people can understand Strong background in data mining and data architecture Solid programming skill in Python, R & SQL Knowledge of AB-testing and the related analysis Hands on experience cleaning datasets and training data Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) Must possess effective verbal and written communication skills Desired Skills: Bachelor Degree from a top 25 school in a quantitative area Knowledge of the insurance or fintech verticals Hands on experience working with online marketing data Knowledge and experience with pool of available data in a digital environment Familiarity with implementing machine learning through AWS Post undergraduate level coursework in machine learning #LI-JK1 #LI-Remote National General Holdings Corp. is an Equal Opportunity (EO) employer – Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories. job_title: REMOTE Sr. Software Engineer - Python, Machine Learning
job_Description: REMOTE Sr. Software Engineer - Python, Machine Learning If you are a Sr. Software Engineer with Python & Machine Learning experience, please read on!   Job Title:  REMOTE Sr. Software Engineer - Python  Job Location:  100% REMOTE - our headquarters is in NYC  Compensation:  $130K -$170K base salary Depending on Experience  We are a 10-person startup that is using computer vision and machine learning to make videos searchable like the web. We are on a mission to unlock the information and build actionable insights within the worlds video and multimedia. Our company was founded by two former PhD Students at Columbia University and has published and patented foundational research in machine learning, computer vision, multimodal information processing, and multimedia. You'll join a small but diverse group of hackers, scientists, engineers, and business leaders who are committed to creating, perfecting, and sharing the machine learning and multimodal AI technologies that have the power to unlock a world of video data. Our solution is leveraged by Fortune 100 companies to Government agencies and anywhere in between. Top Reasons to Work with Us - Competitive Base Salary ($130K - $170K Depending on Experience)  Comprehensive Benefits Package including stock options and 100% REMOTE working arrangements! The chance to join a small engineering team and make an immediate impact from day one! Work with bleeding edge machine learning technologies What You Will Be Doing Participate in the development of all aspects of our solutions, including the processing pipeline, management console, and auxiliary services. Deliver production code for our backend server infrastructure using a modern Python stack. Launch and deploy code using Docker, AWS, and Terraform as the main deployment platform. Deliver production-ready frontend code and collaborate directly with designers and business executives. Participate in code-review and actively maintain and take an interest in bettering the quality of our production code and software infrastructure. Work closely with business development and product design teams to ensure that the technical design of the system meet business and product needs. Launch and test deployed code in a multi-cloud environment. Participate and lead technical development on projects, and actively engage in the strategy and direction of the company. What You Need for this Position Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or similar with 3+ years experience in the following:   Writing production-level backend code solutions to meet stringent performance requirements Python AWS / Azure / GCP Docker / Kubernetes Terraform APIs & querying databases Machine Learning / AI / Deep Learning experience or interest highly preferred Modern frontend JavaScript frameworks like Vue.js or React, and experience with unidirectional state management. - Version Control - GIT What's In It for You - Competitive salary ($130K - $170K base depending on experience)  Medical, dental, and health benefits 401k savings plan w/ up to 3% match Unlimited PTO 100% REMOTE Office Equipment Reimbursement Gym Membership So, if you are a Sr. Software Engineer with Python & Machine Learning experience, please apply today! or send an updated copy of your resume to  Mike.Vandenbergh@CyberCoders.com  for immediate consideration! Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information about available benefits, please contact Mike Vandenbergh Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.  CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   Your Right to Work  – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
